About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

My name is Ethan Matthews, and I’m a career Software Developer. Born and raised in Dartmouth Nova Scotia. I’ve studied Information Technology at Nova Scotia Community College. I’m first and foremost PC hobbyist but I also enjoy games, music and movies. I’m a pleasant individual that’s reliable and works well with others. I bring critical thinking , problem solving and transferable skills with me - wherever I go.

Transcontinental Printing

Digital Bindery Operator

My first full-time employment. I worked for Transcontinental Printing for seven years. Two years a bindery laborer and then another five years a Digital Bindery Operator.

During that time, I learned numerous skills:

  • Graphic design working with abode Photoshop and Illustrator.
  • The importance of efficiency in the production world, using the 5S system. A tool that’s part of the “Kaizen” manufacturing efficiency methodology.
  • Scheduling of jobs and how to meet deadlines. How to stay on top of a dynamic workflow.
  • Time Management.
  • Production Flow - Supply and Demand.
  • Quality Inspection and the importance of Customer Satisfaction.

Transcontinental was a positive experience for me. The people I worked with were great mentors -instilling a healthy work ethic.

NSCC Information Technology

Information Technology Generalist Diploma

I studied Information Technology at NSCC for two years. The Generalist Diploma has provided me with a wide range of knowledge in computer technologies and IT skills. Through both core and elective courses designed to represent the IT needs of my region, the program allowed me to focus on specific areas of study, depending on specific industry needs.

Core Areas of Study:

  • Logic & Programming.
  • Databases & Relational Data.
  • Mobile App Design & Development.
  • Web Design & Development.
  • Networking & Security.
  • Business Analysis & Project Management.
  • Professional Practices & Social Media Tools.

This Diploma has allowed me to peruse any field in the IT Industry.

Lockheed Martin Canada Co-Op

Technical Co-Op Sr.

I spent four months at Lockheed Martin Canada for a Co-op Placement. This was my first time in the Software Development world. It was a great experience. I met kind, friendly, and helpful people with an abundance of knowledge pertaining to the Software Development Industry. I learned many useful skills while working there.

Skills Learned:

  • How a software team works together.
  • Sprint Planning’s & Daily Scrums.
  • Metrics Recording.
  • Task breakdowns and planning.
  • Free Open Source Software Licensing (FOSS).
  • General Knowledge of Industry Standards.
  • General Knowledge of Government Contact Work.

This was an excellent opportunity – I couldn’t have asked for a better Co-Op placement!
